jarvis.sklearn package¶

Submodules¶

jarvis.sklearn.get_desc module¶

Classical Force-field Inspired Descriptors (CFID) Find details in: https://journals.aps.org/prmaterials/abstract/10.1103/PhysRevMaterials.2.083801

jarvis.sklearn.get_desc.el_combs(s=[])[source]¶

Get element combinations for a Structure object

Parameters:s – Structure object
Returns:combinations
Return type:comb
jarvis.sklearn.get_desc.flatten_out(arr=[], tol=0.1)[source]¶

Determine first cut-off

Parameters:
  • arr – array
  • tol – toelrance
Returns:

cut-off for a given tolerance tol, because sometimes RDF peaks could be very close
Return type:

rcut
jarvis.sklearn.get_desc.get_chemonly(string='')[source]¶

Get only mean chemical descriptors for a chemical formula, say Al2O3

Parameters:string – chemical formula, say Al2O3, NaCl etc.
Returns:average chemical descriptors
Return type:mean_chem
jarvis.sklearn.get_desc.get_chgdescrp_arr(elm='')[source]¶

Get charge descriptors for an element

Parameters:elm – element name
Returns:array value
Return type:arr
jarvis.sklearn.get_desc.get_comp_descp(struct='', jcell=True, jmean_chem=True, jmean_chg=True, jrdf=False, jrdf_adf=True, print_names=False)[source]¶

Get chemo-structural CFID decriptors

Parameters:
  • struct – Structure object
  • jcell – whether to use cell-size descriptors
  • jmean_chem – whether to use average chemical descriptors
  • jmean_chg – whether to use average charge distribution descriptors
  • jmean_rdf – whether to use radial distribution descriptors
  • jrdf_adf – whether to use radial as well as angle distribution descriptors
  • print_names – whether to print names of descriptors
Returns:

catenated final descriptors
Return type:

cat

Get chemical descriptors for an element

Parameters:elm – element name
Returns:array value
Return type:arr
jarvis.sklearn.get_desc.get_descrp_arr_name(elm='Al')[source]¶

Get chemical descriptors for an element

Parameters:elm – element name
Returns:array value
Return type:arr
jarvis.sklearn.get_desc.get_effective_structure(s=None, tol=8.0)[source]¶

Check if there is vacuum, if so get actual size of the structure and the add vaccum of size tol to make sure structures are independent of user defined vacuum

Parameters:
  • s – Structure object
  • tol – vacuum tolerance
Returns:

re-structure structure with tol vacuum
Return type:

s
jarvis.sklearn.get_desc.get_prdf(s=None, comb='', cutoff=10.0, intvl=0.1, plot_prdf=False, filename='prdf.png')[source]¶

Get partial radial distribution function

Parameters:
  • s – Structure object
  • cutoff – maximum cutoff in Angstrom
  • intvl – bin-size
  • plot_prdf – whether to plot PRDF
  • filename – if plotted the name of the output file
Returns:

max-cutoff to ensure all the element-combinations are included
jarvis.sklearn.get_desc.get_rdf(s=None, cutoff=10.0, intvl=0.1)[source]¶

Get total radial distribution function

Parameters:
  • s – Structure object
  • cutoff – maximum distance for binning
  • intvl – bin-size
Returns:

bins, distribution
jarvis.sklearn.get_desc.packing_fraction(s=None)[source]¶

Get packing fraction

Parameters:s – Structure object
Returns:packing fraction
jarvis.sklearn.get_desc.rdf_ang_dist(s='', c_size=10.0, plot=True, max_cut=5.0)[source]¶

Get radial and angular distribution functions

Parameters:
  • s – Structure object
  • c_size – max. cell size
  • plot – whether to plot distributions
  • max_cut – max. bond cut-off for angular distribution
Retruns:
adfa,adfb,ddf,rdf,bondo Angular distribution upto first cut-off Angular distribution upto second cut-off Dihedral angle distribution upto first cut-off Radial distribution funcion Bond order distribution
jarvis.sklearn.get_desc.smooth_kde(x, y)[source]¶

For making smooth distributions

Module contents¶

Module to integrate machine-learning packages such as scikit-learn with JARVIS data
